newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Australian wool indicator rises 2c to 614c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Australian wool indicator rises 2c to 614c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market rose at auctions in Sydney and Adelaide on Wednesday with the eastern market indicator rising 2.0 cents to 614 cents a kg clean, Wool International (WI) said.
In merino fleece, the fine 19 micron was slightly dearer, 20m 1.5 percent dearer, 21m unchanged, 22m up to 1.0 percent dearer and 23m 0.5 percent dearer.
However, 24/25m were up to 1.5 percent cheaper and 26m 0.5 percent cheaper.
Merino skirtings were up to 1.0 percent dearer in 19/21m but 20m was up to 1.0 percent cheaper.
In crossbreds, 27m was up to 1.0 percent cheaper, 28m was 0.5 percent cheaper and 29/30/31m were slightly dearer.
In cardings, lambs were generally unchanged, locks were firm and crutchings up to 1.0 percent dearer.
There was good general competition with local mills, Japan and Taiwan active, WI said.
Of the 30,125 bales offered in Sydney and Adelaide, 17.5 percent were passed in.
Sales continue on Thursday in Sydney, Adelaide and Fremantle with about 35,700 bales on offer.
